title: wordless_module6
author: wordless_module6
content: Hello guys, I recently shifted to trex miner and i am getting this error. "Can't find nonce with device [ID=1, GPU #1], GPU #1: not enough free memory to mine ethash at epoch 515." I am mining on ASUS Turbo 3080 10 gb model. I am not getting what's the problem. Please help me.Motherboard: Asrock B450 Steel legendCPU: Ryzen 9 5950x (for cpu mining)Ram: 16gbOS: HiveStorage: 120GB

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Since you're talking about ethash, you should post this on the alts mining section. Post more data especially your setup detail so experienced users can help you more. Also try to search on google for this, since there's a lot of related posts about this one and one of the solution might be able to help you. CMIIW.

comments.author: wordless_module6
comments.body: Thank you for the reply. I searched on google and I think its the motherboard issue. I will check the pcie slots

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: wordless_module6 on September 02, 2022, 06:06:01 AMHello guys, I recently shifted to trex miner and i am getting this error. "Can't find nonce with device [ID=1, GPU #1], GPU #1: not enough free memory to mine ethash at epoch 515." I am mining on ASUS Turbo 3080 10 gb model. I am not getting what's the problem. Please help me.Motherboard: Asrock B450 Steel legendCPU: Ryzen 9 5950x (for cpu mining)Ram: 16gbOS: HiveStorage: 120GBDownload the latest version of hive os.Try using a different miner.Ask a question in these threadshttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5405131First you need to update the operating system for mining and change the miner to make sure that this is not a software error.Do you have one video card or several?

comments.author: rdluffy
comments.body: It's weird, because this problem usually happens with GPUs with less than 5gb to mine ethash algo in ETHmy quick suggestion, change miner, try NBminer or GMiner for example.If you want to stick with trex you can ask here on official thread: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=4432704.0It's not a rare issue as you can see here: https://hiveon.com/forum/t/error-causing-trex-miner-to-restart/32463More people had this problem, but honestly, just change the miner, I think it's not worth the time to solve with ETH almost changing to pos

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: I am too lazy to google the motherboard and look up the specs. But does it have an onboard video? Onboard video is when there is some  basic GPU already built into the motherboard.Most likely it’s trying to mine on that card which obviously doesn’t have enough memory. You should manually try and select a GPU, try GPU = 0. You can also try changing the platforms around and see if it works.If it doesn’t then make sure your virtual memory is very large. Sometimes this can be an issue.

comments.author: JayDDee
comments.body: It's not an iGPU issue, there's no iGPU on a 5950x.Troubleshooting is needed. Load GPUZ to find out what it thinks about your GPU. Make sure HiveOS recongizes it correctly.Try different miners, different algos. What works? What doesn't?

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: (ethash, autolykos2) LHR 100% unlock (except 3080 12GB and 3050)LHR unlocker requires 512.xx version of the driver on Windows, and 510.xx on Linuxhttps://github.com/trexminer/T-Rex/releases/tag/0.26.1There may be a problem with the drivers. Check your miner version and driver versionhttps://github.com/trexminer/T-Rex/releases?page=1All links can be found in this post.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=4432704
